Analysis of the synovial fluid obtained during an exploratory puncture reveals :

- the presence of inflammatory joint fluid (cellularity greater than 2,000 nucleated cells/mm<sup>3</sup>, sometimes very high up to 100,000/mm<sup>3</sup>), predominantly neutrophils

- Negative results from routine bacteriological tests (possible combination!)

- Inconsistent presence of microcrystals.

properties.question: What is the characteristic feature of the inflammatory fluid in the synovial fluid of a patient with microcrystalline arthropathies?
properties.option_a: Highly cellular fluid with a high concentration of neutrophils
properties.option_b: Lowly cellular fluid with a low concentration of neutrophils
properties.option_c: Fluid with a high concentration of microcrystals
properties.option_d: Fluid with a low concentration of microcrystals
